content: heel flap you will pick up roundly half the number of row you knitted for my 39 row i picked up 20 sts if you have used one of the colours from the argyll check for the heel then the second colour should be waiting for you at this point use it to m1 in the gap before your instep sts work across the instep sts according to the next row in the pattern chart using the row of the foot chart that will continue the argyll check correctly m1 in the gap before the heel flap using the same colour that you used for the m1 on the other side pick up and knit 1 st in each slipped st up the other side of the heel flap alternating your colours as you go along make sure you have picked up the same number of sts as before k the 9 sts to the centre back maintaining the 1 by 1 colour change you will from now on work the sole portion in the 1 x 1 stripe as established and the argyll pattern on the top of the foot decrease the sts for the gusset as follows round 1 work the sole sts in pattern until 1 st before the beginning of the top of the foot in the first round this st will be the m1 from the last round k2 decrease making sure to use the correct colour i e work it in the colour of the first square of the argyll chart work across instep according to pat- tern chart until one st before end of instep ssk work to centre back in sole stripe round 2 work the sole in stripe and the instep in pattern without decreasing alternate these two rounds until you have reduced the foot back to 72 sts if you need a different dimension for the foot work more or fewer decreases accordingly onopordum page 4 foot work the foot part in the established patterns until you have 2 5 inches / 6 cm less than your desired foot length toe just to explain you currently have two sts more on the instep than on the sole so the first few rounds are designed to decrease the top of the foot only so that the later decreases can fall in line with the stripe s edges as the length of the foot is individual to everybody it s not really possible to provide a chart for the toe work the argyll according to the established pattern but pay special attention to the fact that with each decrease you will have to start the chart another square further in if you find this too confusing you could always work the toe plain in just one of the colours round 1 work 16 sts in stripe place marker k1 ssk still in stripe colour sequence work across top according to chart until 1 st before sole k2tog k1 place second marker work
